intro: Balsamea berryi, commonly known as the Florida balsam, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in wet, sandy soils near water sources such as swamps and marshes. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Balsamea berryi is part of the Gesneriaceae family and is known for its ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
